ja79:1.1: A village headman conspires with bandits to leave a village helpless and ripe for the plunder.
ja79:1.3: Āgamā is aorist singular. | See the nearly identical phrase at MN 76:53.5; here we have puttahatāya rather than puttamatāya, but both mean the same thing.
ja79:1.4: The expression kharassara is used for the beating of a drum to announce an execution (SN 12.70:28.5).
